channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: President Trump's Board of Peace will meet for the first time Thursday
item.description: As President Trump's Board of Peace prepares to meet for the first time Thursday, he says the group has raised $5 billion for Gaza reconstruction. But key challenges remain.
item.content:encoded: As President Trump's Board of Peace prepares to meet for the first time Thursday, he says the group has raised $5 billion for Gaza reconstruction. But key challenges remain.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Can President Trump's Board of Peace bring lasting peace to Gaza?
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Middle East expert Aaron David Miller of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace about the prospect of lasting peace in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Middle East expert Aaron David Miller of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace about the prospect of lasting peace in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: 8 dead, 1 still missing after avalanche strikes backcountry skiers near Lake Tahoe
item.description: Eight people are dead after being caught in an avalanche northwest of Lake Tahoe. Dangerous conditions are making it difficult to locate one person who is still missing and presumed dead.
item.content:encoded: Eight people are dead after being caught in an avalanche northwest of Lake Tahoe. Dangerous conditions are making it difficult to locate one person who is still missing and presumed dead.
item.dc:creator: Kat Fulwider

item.title: U.K.'s ex-Prince Andrew is released after his arrest over Epstein revelations
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the British former prince, was released after spending the day in police custody but is still under investigation on suspicion of misconduct in public office.
item.content:encoded:
Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the British former prince, was released after spending the day in police custody but is still under investigation on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump's Board of Peace to meet for the first time, latest round of talks to end war in Ukraine conclude with little progress, Meta CEO defends the platform in social media addiction trial.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's Board of Peace to meet for the first time, latest round of talks to end war in Ukraine conclude with little progress, Meta CEO defends the platform in social media addiction trial.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: In 'Mixed Marriage Project,' a woman explores her dad's study of interracial couples
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks professor Dorothy Roberts about her new memoir, "The Mixed Marriage Project," about her father's quest to challenge white supremacy by studying interracial couples in Chicago.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin asks professor Dorothy Roberts about her new memoir, "The Mixed Marriage Project," about her father's quest to challenge white supremacy by studying interracial couples in Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Early voting underway in closely watched Texas Senate Democratic primary
item.description: Early voting began this week in the Texas Senate Democratic primary election, and one candidate got a fundraising bump from talk show host Stephen Colbert.
item.content:encoded: Early voting began this week in the Texas Senate Democratic primary election, and one candidate got a fundraising bump from talk show host Stephen Colbert.
item.dc:creator: Blaise Gainey

item.title: Former South Korean President Yoon sentenced to life for imposing martial law
item.description: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was sentenced to life in prison Thursday for imposing martial law to suppress the opposition in December 2024.
item.content:encoded: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was sentenced to life in prison Thursday for imposing martial law to suppress the opposition in December 2024.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Winter Olympics helps boost interest in curling in the US
item.description: Every four years, the Winter Olympics help curling clubs in the U.S. recruit new members.
item.content:encoded: Every four years, the Winter Olympics help curling clubs in the U.S. recruit new members.
item.dc:creator: Anusha Mathur

item.title: Sen. Bernie Sanders rallies support for proposed tax on billionaires in California
item.description: Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., is in California trying to drum up support for a ballot measure asking for a tax on billionaires.
item.content:encoded: Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., is in California trying to drum up support for a ballot measure asking for a tax on billionaires.
item.dc:creator: Guy Marzorati
